username.description: The username to attach to the HTTP requests sent for this user. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Authentication#access_using_credentials_in_the_url
username.title: Username

password.description: The password to attach to the HTTP requests sent for this user. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Authentication#access_using_credentials_in_the_url
password.title: Password

headers.description: A list of headers to attach to every HTTP requests sent for this user

users.description: The list of users to generate tokens for.
users.title: Users

first_request.description: The parameters of the first HTTP request executed during the digest procedure.It is the one that returns the WWW-Authenticate header.

second_request.description: The parameters of the second HTTP request executed during the digest procedure.It is the one that uses the digest authentication. By default, parameters of the first request are used.

first_request.description: The parameters of the first HTTP request executed during the digest procedure.It is the one that returns the WWW-Authenticate header.

second_request.description: The parameters of the second HTTP request executed during the digest procedure.It is the one that uses the digest authentication. By default, parameters of the first request are used.

parameters.description: The parameters of the HTTP requests executed during the digest procedure.It features two HTTP requests: the first one is the one that returns the WWW-Authenticate header,and the second one is the one that uses the digest authentication.

url.description: The path of the second HTTP request executed during the digest procedure.By default, the path of the first request is used.
url.title: Url

method.description: The method of the second HTTP request executed during the digest procedure.By default, the method of the first request is used.

users.description: A list of users with credentials contained in the GraphQL `variables` of the query
users.title: Users

url.description: The URL of the GraphQL authentication endpoint.
url.title: Url

query.description: The templated GraphQL inside the `query` field of the JSON body of the HTTP request.
query.title: Query

extract.description: The extraction of the GraphQL query containing the user credentials.

inject.description: The injection of the GraphQL query containing the user credentials.

variables.description: The variables of the GraphQL query containing the user credentials.
variables.title: Variables

HTTPMethod.description:
HTTP methods and descriptions

Methods from the following RFCs are all observed:

    * RFC 7231: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1), obsoletes 2616
    * RFC 5789: PATCH Method for HTTP
HTTPMethod.title: HTTPMethod

users.description: The list of users to generate tokens for.
users.title: Users

request.description: The parameters of the HTTP request used to fetch the access and refresh tokens.

extract.description: The token extraction configuration used to extract the tokens from the HTTP response.

inject.description: The injection configuration used to inject the tokens into the HTTP requests.

url.description: The URL to send the request to
url.title: Url

headers.description: The list of headers to attach to the request. Headers are merged with the user credentials headers. It is possible to attach mutliple values to a header.
headers.title: Headers

cookies.description: The list of cookies to attach to the request. Cookies are merged with the user credentials cookies. It is possible to attach mutliple values to a cookie. Cookie values are url-encoded before being sent.
cookies.title: Cookies

query_parameters.description: The list of query parameters to attach to the request. Query parameters are merged with the user credentials query parameters. It is possible to attach mutliple values to a query parameter. Query parameter values are url-encoded before being sent.
query_parameters.title: Query Parameters

body.description: The body of the request. It can be a string or a JSON object. It is merged with the user credentials body if provided. If bodies of the HTTP request and of the user credentials are both JSON objects, they are merged. If the two bodies are strings, they are concatenated. If the two bodies are of different types, the body of the user credentials is used instead of this value.
body.title: Body

proxy.description: An eventual proxy used for this request
proxy.title: Proxy

url.description: The URL to send the request to
url.title: Url

headers.description: The list of headers to attach to the request. Headers are merged with the user credentials headers. It is possible to attach mutliple values to a header.
headers.title: Headers

cookies.description: The list of cookies to attach to the request. Cookies are merged with the user credentials cookies. It is possible to attach mutliple values to a cookie. Cookie values are url-encoded before being sent.
cookies.title: Cookies

query_parameters.description: The list of query parameters to attach to the request. Query parameters are merged with the user credentials query parameters. It is possible to attach mutliple values to a query parameter. Query parameter values are url-encoded before being sent.
query_parameters.title: Query Parameters

body.description: The body of the request. It can be a string or a JSON object. It is merged with the user credentials body if provided. If bodies of the HTTP request and of the user credentials are both JSON objects, they are merged. If the two bodies are strings, they are concatenated. If the two bodies are of different types, the body of the user credentials is used instead of this value.
body.title: Body

parameters.description: The parameters of the HTTP request to send. At least a URL and a method must be provided.

extractions.description: The list of extractions to run at the end of the operation.For HTTP operations, variables are extracted from the response.
extractions.title: Extractions

username.description: The username to attach to the HTTP requests sent for this user. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Authentication#access_using_credentials_in_the_url
username.title: Username

password.description: The password to attach to the HTTP requests sent for this user. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Authentication#access_using_credentials_in_the_url
password.title: Password

headers.description: A dict representing the headers to attach to every HTTP requests sent for this user
headers.title: Headers

cookies.description: A dict representing the cookies to attach to every HTTP requests sent for this user
cookies.title: Cookies

query_parameters.description: A dict of query parameters to attach to every HTTP requests sent for this user
query_parameters.title: Query Parameters

body.description: A body to merge with the bodies of every HTTP requests sent for this user
body.title: Body

users.title: Users

username.description: The name of the user. By default, the username is used.
username.title: Username

users.title: Users

url.description: The URL of the token endpoint of the OpenIDConnect server
url.title: Url

username.description: The arbitrary username given to the user.
username.title: Username

client_id.description: The client ID to use for the OAuth requests
client_id.title: Client Id

client_secret.description: The client secret to use for the OAuth requests
client_secret.title: Client Secret

users.description: A list of users to create
users.title: Users

url.description: The URL of the token endpoint of the OpenIDConnect server
url.title: Url

client_id.description: The client ID to use for the OAuth requests
client_id.title: Client Id

client_secret.description: The client secret to use for the OAuth requests
client_secret.title: Client Secret

name.description: The name of the procedure. It must be unique and is used to reference the procedure in users.
name.title: Name

operations.description: The list of operations executed during the procedure. An operation is a unit transaction, like an HTTP request, or a Selenium script. Operations are ordered, and the variables extracted from an operation can be used in the next operations.
operations.title: Operations

injections.description: The list of injections to perform at the end of the procedure. Injections are used to inject the variables extracted from the procedure into the user authentication.
injections.title: Injections

tests.description: The tests of the Selenium script.
tests.title: Tests

parameters.description: The parameters of the Selenium operation.

wait_for_seconds.description: The number of seconds to wait at various steps of the script. For example when waiting for a page to load.
wait_for_seconds.title: Wait For Seconds

proxy.description: The proxy used to run the script.
proxy.title: Proxy

project.description: The Selenium project used to run the script. It is the one that contains the tests and commands to run. The project script can be generated using the Selenium IDE. See https://www.selenium.dev/selenium-ide/docs/en/introduction/getting-started/

options.description: The options of the Selenium script.

location.description: The location of the HTTP request where the value should be extracted

key.description: The key to use for the extracted value, depending on the location
key.title: Key

regex.description: The regex to use to extract the token from the key value. By default the entire value is taken.
regex.title: Regex

name.description: The name of the variable to store the extracted value into
name.title: Name

location.description: The location of the HTTP request where the token should be injected

key.description: The key to use for the injected token. Its usage depends on the location. For headers, cookies,and query parameters, this key describes the name of the header, cookie or query parameter. For a body location, the key is the field where the token should be injected within the request bodies
key.title: Key

prefix.description: A prefix to prepend to the token before it is injected
prefix.title: Prefix

variable.description: The name of a variable to retrieve to create the token's value. If not provided, the token will be infered as the first successful extraction of the procedure
variable.title: Variable

credentials.description: A set of HTTP parameters used to customize requests sent for the user.

procedure.description: The name of the procedure to use to authenticate the user.This name MUST match the `name` field of a procedure in the `procedures` list in the multiauth configuration.
procedure.title: Procedure

variables.description: List of variables that will be injected at the beginning of the user's authentication procedure.
variables.title: Variables

refresh.description: An optional refresh procedure to follow for the user.

procedure.description: An optional custom procedure to use to refresh the authentication of the user. Defaults to the user procedure if not provided. This name MUST match the `name` field of a procedure in the `procedures` list in the multiauth configuration.
procedure.title: Procedure

session_seconds.description: Number of seconds to wait before refreshing the authentication. If not provided, multiauth willtry to infer the session duration from the returned variables
session_seconds.title: Session Seconds

keep.description: If true, multiauth will keep the current tokens and use a merge of the refreshed authenticationand the current one.
keep.title: Keep

credentials.description: Credentials to use to refresh the authentication. If not provided, the user credentials will be used.

variables.description: List of variables that will be injected at the beginning of the user'srefresh procedure. If not provided, the user's variables will be used instead.
variables.title: Variables

users.description: The list of users to generate tokens for.
users.title: Users

wait_for_seconds.description: The number of seconds to wait at various steps of the script. For example when waiting for a page to load.
wait_for_seconds.title: Wait For Seconds

extract.description: The token extraction configuration used to extract the tokens from the HTTP response.

inject.description: The injection configuration used to inject the tokens into the HTTP requests.

username.description: The arbitrary name that identifies the user.
username.title: Username

password.description: The password to attach to the HTTP requests sent for this user. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Authentication#access_using_credentials_in_the_url
password.title: Password

headers.title: Headers

cookies.title: Cookies

query_parameters.title: Query Parameters

body.description: A body to merge with the bodies of every HTTP requests sent for this user
body.title: Body

procedures.description: The list of authentication procedures to rely on when authenticating users
